intro: Myosotis discolor subsp. rosmatina, commonly known as the Rosmatina forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its delicate blue to violet flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and cool climates. It is part of the Primulaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly larger flowers and more robust growth compared to other members of the Myosotis genus.
